page.title: 05Boynton village hall
page.content: Boynton village hall is made of wood. It is a single storey building.It was built in 1940.In 1947 the Stricklands gave it to the village.Before then it was an army hut.It measures 17 metres long and its width is 5 metres.The clubs that use it are the Young Farmers and Tuesday night and the Youth club on a Friday night.The villagers sometimes have whist drives on Thursday nights and the church sometimes uses it for Harvest suppers some people have birthday parties there .In 1980 a local joiner put in some wash basins and the Youth Training Scheme workmen put in a new ceiling and built a wall outside in 1984.
